title: Incremental Static Regeneration for Angular
desc:
What's ISR and what problem does it solve?
Let's take an e-commerce site as an example. This e-commerce site has thousands of clients and thousands of products, and for each product there is a details page.

Because it's an e-commerce site, it should be server-side rendered (probably using Angular Universal) in order for crawlers to read its content that is needed for SEO.

title: Implementing Authentication using AWS Cognito & Amplify in Angular App
desc:
This blog is about implementing authentication in the Angular app using AWS Amplify SDK libraries at the client-side and AWS Cognito user pool at the back-end. Cognito Identity pool is used to get the access token to upload documents into S3.

It also contains Angular route guards to redirect a user to the login page if the user directly accesses the home page without sign-in.

title: Setting up a mock backend with Angular 13 Applications
desc:
In a world of simultaneous front-end and back-end development, it is essential that the Angular developers working on an app should be able to interact with a fake back end in order to create the UI by mocking the back end data.

Thanks to npm packages like json-server and nodemon, the process is made real simple.

title: S2E11 - Nathan Walker on Innovating
desc: In today's episode of NgXP, we're joined by Nathan Walker from nStudios to talk about innovation in programming. What exactly is innovation? Is it right for your career path in programming? How do you develop the skills necessary to be successful at innovating and how do you even start AND finish the process? Nathan answers all these questions and more, including how and why developers benefit from innovating, what the process of innovation looks like (both the good and the bad), and how to create a support system to help you see your goals come to life.

title: Implementing a custom Angular location strategy
desc: I decided to implement my own CustomHashLocationStrategy, based on the built-in HashLocationStrategy. The callback route will not have a #, and the CustomHashLocationStrategy is responsible for detecting this route and adding the # to the front of it. This is the only custom behaviour, it is otherwise identical to HashLocationStrategy. This way, existing bookmarks will continue to work, because the app is still using the HashLocationStrategy.

title: Custom Validation and Error Code | Reactive Forms | Angular 13+
desc: We have learned how to validate a form control using Angular's built-in validators. But it is also possible to create our own custom validators. Also remember that, every validator returns a validation error code whenever that validation fails on a form control.

desc: tl;dr: mergeMap's concurrent parameter can limit the number of simultaneously active inner subscriptions and thus makes it a pretty decent mutex/semaphore.

title: Angular World Tour: Vienna
How caching data in Angular with RxJS
desc:
When we build app, some data like the menu, options don't change with frecuency. The best approach is to cache it, because when the user move arround the app the data to server again impact in the speed and user experience.

RxJS provide to us an easy way to build a cache and store it, two operators make the magic happen , share and shareReplay to avoid get the data everytime and also avoid calculation.

She's the author of Step by Step Angular Routing (BPB, 2019) and A Hands-on Guide to Angular (Educative, 2021) as well as the author of Web Almanac 2021 JavaScript chapter. Nishu currently works at epilot GmbH as a full stack engineer. She told us about her community involvement, career plans and the best ways to learn web development.

title: Angular, Karma & Jasmine: Testing Image HTTP Service
desc: When writing unit tests for services using the HTTP protocol, we can use the library provided by the Angular framework, dedicated to such tests. Thanks to it, we can check whether the given requests are being executed or not, and also receive a response by 'flushing' each request, and also check whether the application is creating unwanted queries. In this article, you will find a sample test site for downloading, deleting, and uploading photos. Let's get started!

title: Testable Architecture in Angular | Rainer Hahnekamp | Reliable Web Summit 2021
desc: In this live-coding talk, I will show you multiple testing techniques for an Angular application and also discuss their pros and cons. We'll cover a wide range. For example classic unit tests for services, integration tests for component groups but also more specialized ones like marble testing and visual regression. We'll also see how Nx's enterprise patterns help us to apply one specific testing technique per each module type.
